recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, combine water and sugar. Heat until the sugar just melts. Remove from heat and pour in lemon juice. Mix well and chill in refrigerator before serving. Garnish with lemon, lime or orange slices.

review.reviewBody: Tastes grate
This recipe is AMAZING! me and my sisters really enjoyed it and will def make it again! although you should ALWAYS do 1 cup of sugar instead of 1/2

I have a favorite lemonade on this site, but I wanted to try a new one. I didn't care for the ratio of lemon juice to water on this recipe. I prefer half as much water as called for. I did use a no sugar substitute, but that made no difference in the watery taste of the lemonade.
Perfect.Don't change any thing!
I added strawberry's one time but I have made this 4 times this month!!!
awesome recipe will make again

I tried developing an easy sugar free lemonade but could never get the ratios right. I have to admit I didn't make this as it was described but I did use the ratios. I used 3/4 cup bottled lemon juice and 1/2 cup measure for measure artificial sweetener. I just pored everything into a jug and mixed it. No heating. Thank you for giving me the ratios for a refreshing, cool, crisp lemonade.

I put about 1 cup lemon juice (squeezed myself) and 1 cup sugar and filled container (with sugar & juice already in it) TO two quarts... (So 2 qt. total) and it was nice.. Chilling now; I think the whole heating water may've been just to ensure the sugar and water mixed well... Me, I just stirred it for a while.
:-)
Like someone else said, (and I agree, even with minor adjustments I made) "not too tart not too sweet"... and once chilled, I'm sure it'll be "on point"..

Perfect! I was craving a glass of lemonade and this hit the spot! I just dissolved the sugar in one cup of hot tap water, added the lemon juice and a little less than three cups more water. Put on the lid to the jug I was making it in, shook and pored over crushed ice. Yummy! Sweet and tangy enough for my taste.
I made this for me and my parents, they loved it! it's delicious
Vey good and easy to make !! Kids also liked it.

I made this for guests having a meeting at my house. And they all loved it and requested it for the next meeting. I followed the recipe and feel it turned out perfect, not too sweet. I thought my guests would think it was not sweet enough but they thought it was perfect.
loved it loved it so amazing I added a bit of mango and it tasted great
this was okay. it barely had any lemon flavor and not enough sugar. upped the quantities to 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of lemon juice and that was better.
Not that impressed I added a full cup of lemon juice and doubled the sugar we like sweet lemonade! With my alterations turned out Excellent!

This is the perfect lemonade! It wasn't too sweet, which I liked, but it wasn't too tart. I only made about two servings, so I didn't measure out the ingredients. I used the juice of 1 and 1/2 lemons and roughly 1/2 cup sugar and 3/4 cup water. Delicious!

Pretty good! It reminded me of powdered instant, which is weird since I followed the recipe. Light, not too sweet, not too tart. I used Santa Cruz bottled lemon juice, which makes it super easy. It went fast!
Okay. I added 1 1/4 cup of sugar instead of 1/2 a cup. It will probably taste better when its totally cold.
This lemonade was very weak- it needed both more lemons and more sugar. I added about 1/4 cup extra lemon juice, and it was still weak. Used all fresh lemons from a friend's tree.
Keep the 2 qts. of water, but add the juice & pulp of 4 lemons, and about 3/4 cup sugar.
Very good!

I'm not really sure why anyone would think this was alot of steps. My kids have been begging me all summer to make lemonade & I have always said no because I was afraid it would be difficult & messy with 3 little ones. This was surprisingly easy & delicious! We did add a bit more sugar, but you can adjust to your personal liking. Thanks for sharing, we will make this often!
Love this recipe, use it all the time!!
This was really good. I'd never made lemonade before. I recommend using more sugar than it calls for. Next time, maybe I'll add a little OJ to change it up.
YUM!!!! I hate drinking water, this is nice substitute. I am going to try it with stevia just to make it less sugary. Thanks for the recipe
This was very easy and it tastes great. Not too sweet and not too tart.
So easy & perfect! Love it!
This lemonade was disgusting. Way too watery and very gross. Two Thumbs DOWN.
This recipe was too watery for my liking. It tasted alright, but some of the water needed to be cut out.
this recipe is easy and tasty, but it's too tart... I recommend that you use more sugar! maybe double the sugar quantity
quenches the dry throat when takin medication that makes your mouth dry!
Not enough sugar and not enough lemon
Pretty good, just when you're making it on TV, make sure the pitcher is big enough to hold ALL the lemonade, lol. BIG Mistake.
I very much enjoyed this recipe. I love lemonade in general. I did have to add more lemons and sugar, but mostly because I enjoy a more strong lemon taste. Very easy!
My children make this and have a lemonade stand and the people love it.
This lemonade was quick and easy but not enough lemon for me. I felt like I was drinking lemon flavor kool-aid with a lemon added.

nice and easy recipe. not sweet just right.

-Big Jesse
Refreshing!!!!
Easy lemonade recipe. Very tart though. I would recommend using more sugar. 3/4 or 1 full cup.
This took too many steps to make and was too tart because of too much lemon juice.
Perfect! Not to tart, not to sweet.

I used only lemons and found this to be way too bitter. I read in another recipe that salt might help, but it didn't noticeably improve the taste. Maybe the trick is to use oranges and limes, but I'm not anxious to try this one again.
This is a really quick and easy recipe! (and delicious too!) Tart and Tasty!
I added more sugar. My family likes lemonade a little on the sweet side. :o)
